testInfo.name: Gesamtfragenkatalog zum Test „Leben in Deutschland“ und zum „Einbürgerungstest“

questions.germanQuestion: Welches Wappen gehört zur Freien Hansestadt Bremen?
questions.englishQuestion: Which coat of arms belongs to the Free Hanseatic City of Bremen?
questions.notes: The coat of arms of Bremen often features a key, which is a symbol of the city and its historical significance as a trading center.
questions.learningTechniques: Familiarize yourself with Bremen's coat of arms, which prominently features a key symbol.

resources.description: Learn more about the coat of arms of Bremen.

questions.germanQuestion: Welches ist ein Stadtteil von Bremen?
questions.englishQuestion: Which is a district (Stadtteil) of Bremen?
questions.notes: Hemelingen is one of the districts (Stadtteile) of Bremen, located in the eastern part of the city.
questions.learningTechniques: Familiarize yourself with the districts of Bremen, especially Hemelingen, which is an important residential and industrial area.

resources.description: Learn more about the districts of Bremen.

questions.germanQuestion: Für wie viele Jahre wird das Landesparlament in Bremen gewählt?
questions.englishQuestion: For how many years is the state parliament in Bremen elected?
questions.notes: The state parliament in Bremen is elected for a term of 5 years.
questions.learningTechniques: Remember that the term length for the Bremen state parliament is 5 years, aligning with many other German states.

resources.description: Learn more about the political system in Bremen.

questions.germanQuestion: Ab welchem Alter darf man in Bremen bei den Wahlen zur Bürgerschaft (Landtag) wählen?
questions.englishQuestion: At what age can you vote in the elections to the state parliament (Bürgerschaft) in Bremen?
questions.notes: In Bremen, citizens can participate in elections for the state parliament starting at the age of 16.
questions.learningTechniques: Remember that 16 is the voting age for state elections in Bremen, which is a progressive policy compared to other states.

resources.description: Learn more about voting rights in Bremen.

questions.germanQuestion: Welche Farben hat die Landesflagge von Bremen?
questions.englishQuestion: What are the colors of the state flag of Bremen?
questions.notes: The state flag of Bremen consists of the colors red and white, often in a checkered pattern.
questions.learningTechniques: Remember the red and white colors of Bremen's flag, which are associated with the city's maritime and trading history.

resources.description: Learn more about the flag of Bremen.

questions.germanQuestion: Wo können Sie sich in Bremen über politische Themen informieren?
questions.englishQuestion: Where can you get information on political topics in Bremen?

options.germanOption: bei der Landeszentrale für politische Bildung
options.englishOption: at the State Center for Civic Education

questions.notes: In Bremen, the 'Landeszentrale für politische Bildung' (State Center for Civic Education) is the primary resource for information on political topics.
questions.learningTechniques: Focus on the role of the 'Landeszentrale für politische Bildung' in educating the public about political matters in Bremen.

resources.description: Learn more about the State Center for Civic Education in Bremen.

questions.notes: Bremen is one of the three city-states in Germany, alongside Berlin and Hamburg. These states are both cities and federal states.
questions.learningTechniques: Remember that Bremen, Berlin, and Hamburg are the city-states ('Stadtstaaten') of Germany.

resources.description: Learn more about the city-states of Germany.

questions.notes: Bremen is located in the northwest of Germany and is one of the country's three city-states.
questions.learningTechniques: Familiarize yourself with Bremen's location as a city-state in northwestern Germany.

resources.description: Learn more about Bremen's geographical and political status.

questions.germanQuestion: Wie nennt man die Regierungschefin/den Regierungschef des Stadtstaates Bremen?
questions.englishQuestion: What is the title of the head of government in the city-state of Bremen?
questions.notes: The head of government in Bremen is called the 'Erste Bürgermeisterin' or 'Erster Bürgermeister,' which translates to 'First Mayor.'
questions.learningTechniques: Remember that the title 'First Mayor' is used in Bremen, one of Germany's city-states.

resources.description: Learn more about the political structure of Bremen.

questions.germanQuestion: Welche Senatorin/welchen Senator hat Bremen nicht?
questions.englishQuestion: Which senator does Bremen not have?
questions.notes: Bremen, like other German states, does not have a Senator for Foreign Relations ('Senator für Außenbeziehungen'), as foreign policy is managed at the federal level.
questions.learningTechniques: Remember that foreign relations are handled by the federal government in Germany, not by individual states like Bremen.

resources.description: Learn more about the political structure of Bremen.
